Class HumanPlayer

  • java.lang.Object
    • HumanPlayer

  • public class HumanPlayer
extends java.lang.Object
    The HumanPlayer class represents the human-controlled player in The Dice Game.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private static java.lang.String CURRENT_SCORE_FORMAT
      The format-String for the message displaying the player's current score.
      private java.util.Scanner kb
      A Scanner on standard input, which is where the human player provides their input on whether or not to roll the dice (as opposed to showing).
      private static char NO_INPUT_1
      If the first character of the response input by the user is this character, interpret the response as "No".
      private static char NO_INPUT_2
      If the first character of the response input by the user is this character, interpret the response as "No".
      private static java.lang.String ROLL_AGAIN_QUESTION
      The prompt to be output asking whether the user would like roll the dice (instead of showing).
      private int score
      The human player's current score.
      private static char YES_INPUT_1
      If the first character of the response input by the user is this character, interpret the response as "Yes".
      private static char YES_INPUT_2
      If the first character of the response input by the user is this character, interpret the response as "Yes".

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      HumanPlayer()
      Creates a new human player, initializing the user's score to zero and opening a Scanner on standard input.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addToScore(int value)
      Adds the given value to the human player's current score.
      int getScore()
      Returns the human player's current score.
      boolean wantsToRoll()
      Asks the human player whether or not to roll, as opposed to showing.

    • Method Detail

      • getScore

        public int getScore()
        Returns the human player's current score.
        Returns:
        the human player's current score.

      • addToScore

        public void addToScore(int value)
        Adds the given value to the human player's current score.
        Parameters:
        value - the amount to add to the human player's current score.

      • wantsToRoll

        public boolean wantsToRoll()
        Asks the human player whether or not to roll, as opposed to showing. First, output the player's current score. Then, repeatedly ask the user whether or not they want to roll, until they input a line starting with YES_INPUT_1, YES_INPUT_2, NO_INPUT_1, or NO_INPUT_2.
        Returns:
        true if the human player elects to roll, false otherwise.
